content:
Hey, I've noticed that Maturity Level of Questionnaire in the STU-3 dev build has dropped to 0 ( http://hl7-fhir.github.io/questionnaire.html ) it was previously 2 in the DSTU-2 release.

Is this just an error or is it related to the introduction of enabled, initial etc indicating that it's less mature than thought?
There was a bug in the generator that was asserting that warnings existed even though none were reported. It will likely be level 3 before publication.

Thanks for that. Related, is there more detail somewhere about the use cases enableWhen is targeted at solving (beyond what's written in the spec). Unless I'm miss-reading it seems to only support a equality match. So while it makes sense for boolean, coding, maybe string, the full range of types in the answer seems odd (i.e. exact match on an attachment, url or decimal rather than just a hasAnswer)

It can also enable/disable if a question is answered or not. I can't imagine enabling/disabling a question or section based on what url is typed or attachment is selected. If you want to start to get into math, then you're looking at using an extension that uses CQL or FluentPath to do your determinations
I could imagine that you might have an enable-when field to capture a title or description if an attachment is included, not on what the attachment is.

Half wondering if we might be able to support a fluentpath expression for the enable when, now that would be cool.
Need a fluentpath js engine though.
